answer_found_by_llm: The password used for successful authentication to the FTP server is AfricaCTF2021.
The host 192.168.1.26 queried the DNS server at 192.168.1.10, which is an IPv4 address. There is no IPv6 address associated with the DNS server in this capture.
The domain name being looked up in packet number 15174 is www.7-zip.org.
10 UDP packets were sent from the internal host 192.168.1.26 to the external IP address 24.39.217.246.
The MAC address of the potentially compromised internal system is c8:09:a8:57:47:93.

The server certificate public key is an RSA key with exponent 65537 and modulus `0x00c6230af3c310611c92bf9aa59b8d89b419fe3c...` (truncated).  This is the public key from the certificate for `smartscreen.microsoft.com`.
No TLS 1.3 client randoms were found associated with protonmail.com in the provided pcap file.
Yes, the MAC address of the FTP server is registered in Germany.
No non-standard folders were created on the FTP server on April 20th according to the pcap data.

I cannot determine the domain the user connected to in packet 27300. The packet is a TCP SYN packet to a non-standard port (16993), and there's no domain information available at this stage of the connection.
